page.title: 06TISBURY FISH FARM,NOAK HILL
page.content: The fish farm was opened in 1969. Everything for the garden pond can be bought at the farm, all the fish are for cold water ponds and are bred on the farm, although some of the original stock came from{China}and{ {Japan.}People from all over Britain buy fish from the farm and orders for certain types of fish come from afar afield as{Australia and America.} From March 1st - October 31st the farm is open seven days a week from 10 am. to 5 pm.. During the winter it is only open for 4 days from 10 am. to 4 pm.. Of the 8 acres of the farm 3.5 acres are{Spice Pitts Woods.}There are 21 small breeding ponds. As a boy,{Mr. Tisbury}started breeding fish as a hobby, when he grew up he opened a shop in{Walthamstoe}and later moved to Spice Pitts Farm.
